In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a simple Julia function that accomplishes the task:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            if !isempty(current_line)
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        end
    end

    # Add last line
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end


# Example:
println(wrap_string("Hello world from another galaxy and universe"))
println(wrap_string("Some long text that will need to be wrapped each time max text width is exceeded", text_width=20))
```
